definition: Ox-Head, one of the two guardians of the underworld in Chinese mythology
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: variant of 牛頭梗|牛头梗[niu2 tou2 geng3]
(bird species of China) bull-headed shrike (Lanius bucephalus)

sentences.english: He produced bulldogs that was great producers and match dogs.
sentences.chinese: 他制作的牛头犬队的比赛是伟大的生产者和狗。

sentences.english: Even if cattle, horsed were sent from hell.
sentences.chinese: 阴间即使派来牛头马面。

sentences.english: We tauren have always held a great respect for the works of the Earth Mother.
sentences.chinese: 我们牛头人非常尊重大地母亲的自然杰作。

sentences.english: Consumer spending is a major shaper of overall economic activity.
sentences.chinese: 消费性开支是一个全部经济的活动主要的牛头刨床。

sentences.english: These are the friendliest darn bulldogs in the world.
sentences.chinese: 它们是世界上最友好的牛头犬。

sentences.english: Very fast, yang Zhi produced conflict with bovine head side.
sentences.chinese: 很快，杨志就与牛头帮发生了冲突。
牛头狗队这个周末输了球。

sentences.english: This god which has the head of a cow was normally placed inside a mummy.
sentences.chinese: 这种牛头人身的神像通常被放在木乃伊体内。

sentences.english: Never eat beef with a tauren.
sentences.chinese: 永远不要和牛头人一起吃牛肉。

sentences.english: There is a new version coming. They look similar to the Tauren but have the Buffalo-esque head.
sentences.chinese: 新版本中他们看起来会像长着美洲野牛脑袋的牛头人。

sentences.english: Tests revealed the first-ever sex reversal in this dog breed.
sentences.chinese: 测试结果显示，这是首例牛头犬性反转现象。

sentences.english: What is the name of the Tauren city seen in the movie and screenshots. Where is it located?
sentences.chinese: 视频和截图中的牛头人城市叫什么，位于哪里？

sentences.english: The ancient and wizened tauren sat in front of the fire, warming his old bones.
sentences.chinese: 年迈干瘪的牛头人坐在火前，温暖着自己的老骨头。

sentences.english: So, you can see many ox- faces working for the King of Hell.
sentences.chinese: 咁所以帮阎罗王打工个喳都系牛头多过马面。

sentences.english: You know, Taurens are born hunters.
sentences.chinese: 你要知道，牛头人是天生的猎手。

definition: person/number of people/(per) capita/(a person's) head/(Tw) person whose identity is used by sb else (e.g. to create a bogus account)
leech/bloodsucking vermin/vampire (translated European notion)/fig. cruel exploiter, esp. a capitalist exploiting the workers
variant of 榔頭|榔头[lang2 tou5]
(literary) beauty (usually of a maid or concubine)
